basic_data.Recipient Name: THE REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA
basic_data.Description: DESCRIPTION <(>&<)> BENEFICIARIES THE EXPANDED FOOD AND NUTRITION EDUCATION PROGRAM (EFNEP) PROVIDES FEDERAL FUNDING FOR SCIENCE-BASED OR EVIDENCE BASED ACTIVITIES TO ENABLE LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES TO ENGAGE IN NUTRITIONALLY SOUND FOOD PURCHASE AND PREPARATION PRACTICES. EFNEP IS AUTHORIZED BY SECTION 1425 OF THE NATIONAL AGRICULTURAL RESEARCH, EXTENSION, AND TEACHING POLICY ACT OF 1977 (7 U.S.C. 3175), AND APPROPRIATIONS ARE MADE AVAILABLE PURSUANT TO SECTION 3(D) OF THE SMITH-LEVER ACT. UC AGRICULTURE AND NATURAL RESOURCES (UC ANR) MANAGES EFNEP IN 19 COUNTIES ACROSS CALIFORNIA. EFNEP DELIVERS RESEARCH-BASED NUTRITION EDUCATION TO LIMITED-RESOURCE FAMILIES WITH YOUNG CHILDREN TO ACQUIRE SKILLS, ATTITUDES, AND CHANGED BEHAVIORS NECESSARY FOR NUTRITIONALLY SOUND DIETS THAT CONTRIBUTE TO THEIR PERSONAL DEVELOPMENT AND NUTRITIONAL WELL-BEING. IN FFY2022, UC ANR'S EFNEP PROGRAMS HAD OVER 8,700 ENROLLED IN ITS EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS. ACTIVITIES <(>&<)> OUTCOMES UC COOPERATIVE EXTENSION (UCCE) ACADEMICS PROVIDED OVERSIGHT, LEADERSHIP, AND GUIDANCE FOR EFNEP PROGRAMS. CURRICULA WERE SUCH AS EATING SMART BEING ACTIVE WERE DELIVERED TO HELP ADULT PARTICIPANTS GAIN THE TOOLS NEEDED TO TAKE CONTROL OF THEIR MONEY BY TEACHING FAMILIES FOOD BUYING/BUDGETING SKILLS AND FOOD RESOURCE MANAGEMENT TECHNIQUES. EFNEP EVALUATION RESULTS FROM FFY2022 FOUND THAT ADULT GRADUATES FROM THE PROGRAM STATEWIDE AVERAGED A $33.58 MONTHLY SAVINGS IN THEIR GROCERY BUDGET, WHICH EQUATES TO A $400 SAVINGS ANNUALLY. AFTER COMPLETING EFNEP CLASSES, THE NUMBER OF PARTICIPANTS REPORTING THEY WERE UNABLE TO AFFORD BALANCED MEALS DECREASED FROM 90% TO 33%. IN ADDITION, PROGRAM FAMILIES MAKE STRIDES IN HEALTHY LIFESTYLES PRACTICES. EXAMPLES OF SUCH MEASURED OUTCOMES ARE LISTED BELOW. - PARTICIPANTS ADOPT HOME FOOD SAFETY PRACTICES. DURING FFY 2022 EFNEP SURVEYED OVER 1,650 PARTICIPANTS, AND 82% OF ADULT PARTICIPANTS SHOWED IMPROVEMENT IN ONE OR MORE FOOD SAFETY PRACTICES, SUCH AS THAWING FROZEN FOOD AT ROOM TEMPERATURE LESS OFTEN OR USING A MEAT THERMOMETER, AS A RESULT OF PARTICIPATING IN THE PROGRAM. OUT OF 1,374 YOUTH EFNEP PARTICIPANTS, 51% TO 57% OF YOUTH IN GRADES 3 THROUGH 12 SHOWED IMPROVEMENT IN FOOD SAFETY SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE. - PARTICIPANTS ADOPT HEALTHY EATING PRACTICES. DURING FFY 2022 EFNEP SURVEYED OVER 1,650 ADULT PARTICIPANTS, AND 98% REPORTED IMPROVEMENTS IN THEIR DIET QUALITY, INCLUDING EATING REDDER AND ORANGE VEGETABLES, EATING MORE DARK GREEN VEGETABLES, AND EATING FRUIT MORE OFTEN EACH DAY. OUT OF 1,779 YOUTH EFNEP PARTICIPANTS, 83% REPORTED IMPROVEMENTS IN THEIR DIET QUALITY, INCLUDING EATING MORE FRUIT AND VEGETABLES. - PARTICIPANTS ADOPT HEALTHY LIFESTYLE AND DECISION-MAKING PRACTICES. DURING FFY 2022 EFNEP SURVEYED OVER 1,650 ADULT PARTICIPANTS, AND 85% REPORTED INCREASING THEIR PHYSICAL ACTIVITY. OUT OF 1,765 YOUTH EFNEP PARTICIPANTS, 55% REPORTED INCREASING THEIR PHYSICAL ACTIVITY.
basic_data.Awarding Sub Agency: National Institute of Food and Agriculture
